task.summary:
Initial Commit
Created classes for card and deck with __str__

Woop Woop, I created a class Deck which has enough functions to deal a hand of texas hold em to one person (at the moment)
Now to start writing the comparison functions for finding probabilities. I plan to use regular expressions to divide the cards into rank and suit for comparisons. Probably would have been better to use the card class, but this is written and I can refactor it if need be later.
Just happy to have written this while we are out of cell service and I was forced to think through each problem instead of relying on stack overflow.

At this point, I have written a textual walk through of a single hand in functions, which supplies the variable total_cards with a list of the cards in the hand and on the table. This is done with append, so the list becomes the first element in total_cards which is itself a list.... probably ought to change that but this is a good commit point.

Created a function which uses regular expressions to find a flush in the total_cards list. It first converts the list into a long string and then runs a re.findall for the name of each suit. If there are more than 4, it returns True for flush. Thought of it last night, but struggled to code it today, couldn't recall the .join command
Same as last commit, just got rid of while loop for start new hand function to increase testing speed and will create a main function later anyway
Added function which finds pairs, two pair, three of a kind, four of a kind, full house returns strings describing the hand detected.

Finished function which detects a straight, although it doesn't return the high card yet. Those lines of code which are associated with that part of the function are commented out for now. Out of time today. This proved harder than expected.

Decided to go with pygame for the GUI, created a main game script and a button class. run_game() presently only draws blank screen with a deal button that does nothing. Next, will create class for the cards. Then activate deal button to deal two cards to the player.

Have created and displayed images for the deal button, deck of cards, and the first face down card dealt Opting to go without face down cards being a sprite, and will create a new instance of the card class, using string formatting to input which images to display based on the number of the card dealt and value when turned up... I think, not quite sure how to proceed, may need to change how I display the cards on the table
Refactored code to include a game functions file and actually use the settings file.
Refactored to move images file and Classes file into cards, where the classes belong together
wasted several hours working in circles, need to take a break and see what needs to be done to change the card faces when the button is clicked, which works now

Can't stop thinking about how to fix it, so I fixed it. I have created the stats file which will keep track of where we are in the game, have created the functions which check to see if the deal button is clicked, which work out well. Now I need to see if I can actually change the image which is linked to in the class instantiation of the card image, or if I need to re start a new instance, or if I should create a new card to display over the top of the old card, which is a modified version of a new instance.

Finally got the card images to display properly when you press the deal button. Minor code clean up on some scripts. Now I need to create a new instance of the card class every time we deal a new hand, as is, when calling the local variables the cards deal as the same exact hand every time

Initial Commit
Created classes for card and deck with __str__

Woop Woop, I created a class Deck which has enough functions to deal a hand of texas hold em to one person (at the moment)
Now to start writing the comparison functions for finding probabilities. I plan to use regular expressions to divide the cards into rank and suit for comparisons. Probably would have been better to use the card class, but this is written and I can refactor it if need be later.
Just happy to have written this while we are out of cell service and I was forced to think through each problem instead of relying on stack overflow.

At this point, I have written a textual walk through of a single hand in functions, which supplies the variable total_cards with a list of the cards in the hand and on the table. This is done with append, so the list becomes the first element in total_cards which is itself a list.... probably ought to change that but this is a good commit point.

Created a function which uses regular expressions to find a flush in the total_cards list. It first converts the list into a long string and then runs a re.findall for the name of each suit. If there are more than 4, it returns True for flush. Thought of it last night, but struggled to code it today, couldn't recall the .join command
Same as last commit, just got rid of while loop for start new hand function to increase testing speed and will create a main function later anyway
Added function which finds pairs, two pair, three of a kind, four of a kind, full house returns strings describing the hand detected.

Finished function which detects a straight, although it doesn't return the high card yet. Those lines of code which are associated with that part of the function are commented out for now. Out of time today. This proved harder than expected.

Decided to go with pygame for the GUI, created a main game script and a button class. run_game() presently only draws blank screen with a deal button that does nothing. Next, will create class for the cards. Then activate deal button to deal two cards to the player.

wasted several hours working in circles, need to take a break and see what needs to be done to change the card faces when the button is clicked, which works now

Can't stop thinking about how to fix it, so I fixed it. I have created the stats file which will keep track of where we are in the game, have created the functions which check to see if the deal button is clicked, which work out well. Now I need to see if I can actually change the image which is linked to in the class instantiation of the card image, or if I need to re start a new instance, or if I should create a new card to display over the top of the old card, which is a modified version of a new instance.

Finally got the card images to display properly when you press the deal button. Minor code clean up on some scripts. Now I need to create a new instance of the card class every time we deal a new hand, as is, when calling the local variables the cards deal as the same exact hand every time
